parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Or, its prolonged form opheileo probably from the base of ophelos; to owe; figuratively, to be under obligation; morally, to fail in duty.
To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
